post.body: - markaby has grown on me. As far as abstracted HTML goes, it's the bees knees.
but it doesn't work that way! Diet soda isn't free ticket for unhealthy eating sans consequences. This is where fat people come from.
- is your dumpling meetup a lunch or dinner thing?
- the obesity tax pisses me off x2 because I'm being punished for having a good metabolism. I hate the taste of diet soda.
- I think people just stick with google maps because of it's reputation (and because of MS's lack of a good one).
- Microsoft Live Maps are indeed awesome. Kind of random, but they are the only mapping service w/ driving directions for Mexico.
- you might also want to check out Markaby - http://code.whytheluckystiff.net/markaby/ I prefer it over haml (haml is cool tho)
- lol, yeah a carbon tax is srsly redic. Can you get a rebate if you carry around a plant with you to convert the co2 back to o2?
- your coworker is a grumpyface if he's bitching over a bit of whitespace. I don't use spaces either...
- but the smashing site is fluid down to ~930px... that's actually quite a brilliant layout they have going.
- I'm not a designer, but that donut looking progress bar is scary
- so if that's the Boag definition of understated, I don't even know what you'd call my setup. I go for the Charlie Brown tree.
- that foo hack article was brilliant, I got that setup working, even in FF2. This is going to be so useful, Merry Christmas.
- I think that was about the best Christmas present as I could have received. Thank you very much for that link!
- oh, that might be an idea! Right now they've only been seeking private funds, interesting to see how this will develop.
- Chinese food on xmas is pretty popular anywhere there are large Chinese & Jewish populations. NYC takes the cake, I think.
- the one I really like is in NYC, but they're flex on the hours/location - they just want the right people - it's outbrain.com
- that hi-speed train thing is true, but it's lacking funds and it'll be a long time before it actually happens.
- there's so many great frameworks out now, I think unless there's a serious reason to roll your own it's best to not 'go there'.
Not really feeling today... hopefully the Situation Marketing holiday party tonight will turn my frown upside-down.
Old news: Diet soda doesn't make you skinny, rather it's indicative of a lifestyle which is more likely to make you obese http://bit.ly/dIYu
ZING. Our designer just rickrolled us.
The new NY taxes Patterson has rolled out are redic. Obesity tax for non-diet soda? Next time I see him I'll wave, but not with all fingers.
Yay custom random corners are done, and I actually have a date tonight, so yay! We're gonna eat and go watch the end of the world...
Prototype isn't giving me the border info on a call to $(div).getStyle('border'). I bet $(div).css('border') would work if I used jQuery!
This is awesome - if programming languages were religions - http://bit.ly/16962
I'm waiting on something very important, and I have no idea when it's coming. The anticipation is killing me softly, with no song.
So apparently I have the flu. First time for everything. Wrapped up in a blanket, watching Office season 2. Also: happy 1,000th tweet to me!
Sick with a stomach bug and can't sleep anymore. The definition of suck.
Rar files are incredibly stupid. I don't know what you Windows people are thinking...
Downloading Doctor Who and realizing I'm filling up this 320gig hard drive way too fast. 2/3rds full and growing.
Go watch Seven Pounds - if you want to cry for like, an hour. But seriously, it's a great film about love and loss. Very touching.
Question for the twitterverse: how do you sort your CSS? #css #webdesign
At least 10 times a day I wish I could use inline-block in my CSSing. I'd even settle for some table-cell crap right about now...
I wonder if thai restaurants will be open tomorrow... I don't care much for Chinese food.
Oh and for the record, Northwest airline is a pretty horrible airline.
It's official, my friend is not going to be visiting. Maybe I'll go out for Chinese food tomorrow after all.
RT @sitepointdotcom for their top 15 web tech stories of 2008 - http://tr.im/2mdi A lot of stuff happened this year, some amazing progress.
If any front-end dev types are looking for work, please hit me up. I know of a few opps that look totally awesome.
iPhone games that cancel iTunes music make me angry.
